RCVAccession.Title: NM_000372.5(TYR):c.1467dup (p.Ala490fs) AND SKIN/HAIR/EYE PIGMENTATION 3, LIGHT/DARK SKIN

GermlineClassification.ReviewStatus: criteria provided, multiple submitters, no conflicts

XRef.DB: Department Of Translational Genomics (developmental Genetics Section), King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Centre

AttributeSet.Attribute: The term 'not provided' is registered in MedGen to support identification of submissions to ClinVar for which no condition was named when assessing the variant. 'not provided' differs from 'not specified', which is used when a variant is asserted to be benign, likely benign, or of uncertain significance for conditions that have not been specified.

ClinVarSubmissionID.title: TYR, THR489FS, 1-BP INS_ALBINISM, OCULOCUTANEOUS, TYPE IA

ObservedData.Attribute: See Tripathi et al. (1992) for the 1-bp insertion converting codon 489 from ACT(thr) to ACTT and creating a frameshift.

ClinVarAccession.SubmitterName: Genetic Services Laboratory, University of Chicago

Replaced.Comment: SCV000343461 was merged into SCV000343460 to remove duplication.

Classification.Comment: The c.1467dupT pathogenic variant has been reported in individuals with oculocutaneous albinism1-3 and is of a type expected to cause disease.[1-3] 1. Chintamaneni et al., Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1991 Jun 15;88(12):5272-6. 2. King et al., Hum Genet. 2003 Nov;113(6):502-13. 3. Grønskov et al., Invest Ophthalmol Vis Sci. 2009 Mar;50(3):1058-64.

ClinicalAssertion.Comment: The c.1467dupT pathogenic variant has been reported in individuals with oculocutaneous albinism1-3 and is of a type expected to cause disease.[1-3] 1. Chintamaneni et al., Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1991 Jun 15;88(12):5272-6. 2. King et al., Hum Genet. 2003 Nov;113(6):502-13. 3. Grønskov et al., Invest Ophthalmol Vis Sci. 2009 Mar;50(3):1058-64.

ClinVarAccession.SubmitterName: Institute of Human Genetics, University of Leipzig Medical Center

Classification.Comment: Identified as compund heterozygous with NM_000372.5:c.1205G>A. Criteria applied: PM3_VSTR,PVS1_MOD

SubmitterDescription.SubmitterName: Diagnostic Laboratory, Department of Genetics, University Medical Center Groningen

ClinVarAccession.SubmitterName: Clinical Genetics DNA and cytogenetics Diagnostics Lab, Erasmus MC, Erasmus Medical Center

SubmitterDescription.SubmitterName: Diagnostic Laboratory, Department of Genetics, University Medical Center Groningen

ClinicalAssertion.Comment: ACMG criteria applied: PM3_STR, PVS1_MOD, PS4_MOD, PS3_SUP

Classification.Comment: This sequence change creates a premature translational stop signal (p.Ala490Cysfs*20) in the TYR gene. While this is not anticipated to result in nonsense mediated decay, it is expected to disrupt the last 40 amino acid(s) of the TYR protein. This variant is present in population databases (rs543973275, gnomAD 0.05%). This premature translational stop signal has been observed in individuals with oculocutaneous albinism (PMID: 1642278, 1711223, 13680365, 18463683). ClinVar contains an entry for this variant (Variation ID: 3803). For these reasons, this variant has been classified as Pathogenic.

ClinVarAccession.SubmitterName: Equipe Genetique des Anomalies du Developpement, Université de Bourgogne

Classification.Comment: This variant was observed in compound heterozygosity with c.[575C>A;1205G>A] variants (hypomorphic allele)

Frameshift variant in the C-terminus predicted to result in protein truncation, as the last 40 amino acids are lost and replaced with 19 incorrect amino acids in published literature (Chintamaneni et al., 1991); Published functional studies demonstrate c.1467dupT impairs the C-terminus of the protein and reduces enzyme activity (Chintamaneni et al., 1991); This variant is associated with the following publications: (PMID: 13680365, 1711223, 28667292, 19060277, 1642278, 28451379, 18821858, 18463683, 1409426, 15146472, 34426522, 26689913, 28976636, 18326704)
